DataElement.preferredName: Eligibility HIV Positive With Undetectable HIV Viral Load Receive Highly Active Antiretroviral Therapy Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response indicating whether or not an HIV-positive patient with undetectable HIV viral load is on a stable regimen of highly active anti-retroviral therapy (HAART).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Human Immunodeficiency Virus Positive Patient With Assessment Undetectable HIV Viral Load Measurement Receive Highly Active Antiretroviral Therapy Treatment Regimen
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Human immunodeficiency virus. Species of LENTIVIRUS, subgenus primate lentiviruses (LENTIVIRUSES, PRIMATE), formerly designated T-cell lymphotropic virus type III/lymphadenopathy-associated virus (HTLV-III/LAV). It is acknowledged to be the agent responsible for the acute infectious manifestations, neurologic disorders, and immunologic abnormalities linked to the ACQUIRED IMMUNODEFICIENCY SYNDROME._Confirmation of something, such as a positive lab test. In medicine, a positive lab test indicates the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism. (NCI)_A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._The inability to be noticed, identified or discovered._The determination of the HIV viral load in a specimen._To take, accept, or get something offered._Drug therapy which targets retrovirus function by multiple mechanisms._A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Human immunodeficiency virus. Species of LENTIVIRUS, subgenus primate lentiviruses (LENTIVIRUSES, PRIMATE), formerly designated T-cell lymphotropic virus type III/lymphadenopathy-associated virus (HTLV-III/LAV). It is acknowledged to be the agent responsible for the acute infectious manifestations, neurologic disorders, and immunologic abnormalities linked to the ACQUIRED IMMUNODEFICIENCY SYNDROME.:Confirmation of something, such as a positive lab test. In medicine, a positive lab test indicates the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism. (NCI):A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Concepts.definition: The virus isolated and recognized as the etiologic agent of AIDS. HIV-1 is classified as a lentivirus, a subtype of retroviruses.
Confirmation of something, such as a positive lab test. In medicine, a positive lab test indicates the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism. (NCI)
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: With Undetectable HIV Viral Load Measurement Receive Highly Active Antiretroviral Therapy Treatment Regimen
Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:The inability to be noticed, identified or discovered.:The determination of the HIV viral load in a specimen.:To take, accept, or get something offered.:Drug therapy which targets retrovirus function by multiple mechanisms.:A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
The inability to be noticed, identified or discovered.
The determination of the HIV viral load in a specimen.
To take, accept, or get something offered.
Drug therapy which targets retrovirus function by multiple mechanisms.
A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient is HIV-positive, i
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is HIV-positive, is the patient on a stable regimen of highly active anti-retroviral therapy (HAART) that does not include strong inhibitors and strong or moderate inducers of CYP3A4, has no requirement for concurrent antibiotics or antifungal agents for the prevention of opportunistic infection, CD4 count is above 250 cells/mcL and does patient have an undetectable HIV viral load on standard PCR-based test?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1701 TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is HIV-positive, is the patient on a stable regimen of highly active anti-retroviral therapy not containing a strong inducer or inhibitor of CYP2C9, has no requirement for concurrent antibiotics or antifungal agents for the prevention of opportunistic infection, CD4 count is above 250 cells/mcL, and an undetectable HIV viral load on standard PCR-based test?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1801 Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient is HIV infected, is the patient on effective anti-retroviral therapy with undetectable viral load within 6 months of treatment start?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1804 Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has HIV, are they on effective anti-retroviral therapy with undetectable viral load within 6 months of study start?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient on effective anti-retroviral therapy with undetectable viral load within 6 months from enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient known to be HIV positive meet 3.2.15 protocol criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NGR_CRF_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is HIV-positive, is the patient on effective anti-retroviral  therapy with undetectable viral load within 6 months of study entry and on a stable regimen of highly active anti-retroviral therapy (HAART) that does not require for concurrent antibiotics or antifungal agents for the prevention of opportunistic infection.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient on effective anti-retroviral therapy with an undetectable viral load within 6 months prior to step 2 registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient on effective anti-retroviral therapy with undetectable viral load within 6 months of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient on effective anti-retroviral therapy with undetectable viral load within 6 months of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient on effective anti-retroviral therapy with undetectable viral load within 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient on effective anti-retroviral therapy with undetectable viral load within 6 months of randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient is Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV)-infected, is the patient on effective antiretroviral therapy with an undetectable viral load within 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient on effective anti-retroviral therapy with undetectable viral load within 6 months?
